topic.title: social media detect self-harm
topic.description: Which papers focus on how to recognize signs of self-harm in people's social media posts?
topic.narrative: Relevant papers include research on early detection of self-harm on social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, Reddit, Twitter and co. Papers that addresses mental health issues like depression or anorexia are not relevant. Furthermore, papers that deal with self-harm but are not related to social media are also not relevant.

topic.title: recommendation systems
topic.description: What documents contain information on recommendation systems (systems that suggest items to users based on their past behaviour and interests)
topic.narrative: Relevant documents contain information or research on the topic of recommendation systems in the context of information retrieval.

topic.title: machine learning for more relevant results
topic.description: Which papers describe methods to find more relevant results using machine learning?
topic.narrative: Relevant papers describe one or more methods to find more relevant results using machine learning. Papers about just machine learning in IR in general or papers just about finding more relevant results are not relevant.

topic.title: misspellings in queries
topic.description: Find papers that describe algorithms or datasets for automatic query spelling correction?
topic.narrative: Relevant Information Retrieval documents cover the topic of misspellings in search engine queries and how to automatically correct them. Documents containing only the words "queries" or "in" are not relevant.

topic.title: filter ad rich documents
topic.description: Find papers that describe how (affiliate) spam documents can be classified and removed in the ranking of a search engine.
topic.narrative: Relevant documents cover how spam documents (with tons of ads and pop ups) can be classified and/or removed from search results.
